name: Application Log
title: Application Log Pipelines
deleteTips: Are you sure you want to delete the application log

detail.tip1: If you create an ingestion from an instance group, make sure you have attached these
detail.tip3: to the instances. This is NOT required if you create ingestion from Syslog or EKS cluster.

ingestion.deleteTips: Are you sure you want to delete the log ingestion(s)?
ingestion.eksTips1: If you need to create additional EKS ingestions in this pipeline, go to
ingestion.eksTips3: create ingestion and select current pipeline.
ingestion.oneMoreStep: One more step to complete the ingestion setup...
ingestion.groupTips: We detect you had created an ingestion with an instance group based on EC2 auto scaling group, please wait for the ingestion's status become "Created", then go to the detail page of instance group(s), and follow the Auto Scaling Group Guide to update the User Data in the associated Launch Configuration.

permission.name: Instance Permission
permission.alertDesc: Solution use Systems Manager to configure and update Log Agent, S3 to store configurations and Kinesis to collect data. Please grant the following permissions to your EC2 Instance Profile or Autoscaling group. Learn more about

ingestSetting.indexNameDesc: Enter the index name of the log saved in OpenSearch.
ingestSetting.indexNameFormatError: Index name must start with a lowercase letter and can only support lowercase letter, number, - and _
ingestSetting.bufferNoneDesc: Log will ingested to OpenSearch directly. Use this option if your OpenSearch domain can support your log peak througput.
ingestSetting.bufferKDSDesc: Second-level ingestion with additional cost. Use this option if you need real-time ingestion and your log througput is higher than your OpenSearch domain ingestion capacity.
ingestSetting.bufferS3Desc: Minute-level ingestion with additional cost. Use this option if you can accept minute-level latency for your log ingestion and your log througput is higher than your OpenSearch domain ingestion capacity.
ingestSetting.s3BucketDesc: Select a bucket to store the log data. By default. The solution will add prefix of 'AppLogs/<index-prefix>/year=%Y/month=%m/day=%d' (in UTC) to log data. You can customize the prefix in additional settings.
ingestSetting.s3PrefixInvalid: Amazon S3 Bucket Prefix should not end with '/'
ingestSetting.s3BucketPrefixDesc1: By default, Solution appends the prefix '
ingestSetting.s3BucketPrefixDesc2: ' (in UTC) to the data it delivers to Amazon S3. You can override this default by specifying a custom prefix that includes expressions that are evaluated at runtime.
ingestSetting.bufferSizeDesc: Specify the buffer size in your log source before sending to Amazon S3. The higher buffer size may be lower in cost with higher latency. The lower buffer size will be faster in delivery with higher cost. Minimum: 1 MiB, maximum: 50 MiB.
ingestSetting.bufferSizeError: The size of the buffer must be between 1MiB and 50MiB
ingestSetting.bufferIntDesc: The higher interval allows more time to collect data and the size of data may be bigger. The lower interval sends the data more frequently and may be more advantageous when looking at shorter cycles of data activity.
ingestSetting.bufferIntError: The Buffer interval must be between 1 second and 86400 seconds
ingestSetting.compressTypeDesc: Solution can compress records before delivering them to your S3 bucket
ingestSetting.shardNumDesc: Specify the number of Shards of the Kinesis Data Streams. Each shard can have up to 1,000 records per second and total data write rate of 1MB per second. (* Kinesis shard adjustment limit per 24 hours)
ingestSetting.shardNumError: Shard Number must be greater than or equal to 1
ingestSetting.enableAutoSDesc: Enable auto scaling of the Kinesis Data Streams shards?
ingestSetting.maxShardNumError: Max Shard Number must be greater than Shard number
ingestSetting.duplicatedWithPrefix: You have a log pipeline that used this index prefix.
ingestSetting.overlapWithPrefix: The index prefix overlaps with the index prefix you created earlier.
ingestSetting.duplicatedWithInvalidPrefix: You have a deleted log pipeline that used this index prefix. If you keep creating this log pipeline, your logs will get mixed up.
ingestSetting.overlapWithInvalidPrefix: The index prefix overlaps with the index prefix you removed earlier. If you continue to create this pipeline, your logs will get mixed up.
ingestSetting.s3StorageClassDesc: Select a storage class for the prefix that buffer your log data.

specifyOS.aosDomainDesc1: Select an imported cluster. You must
specifyOS.aosDomainDesc3: before you select from the list.
specifyOS.warmLogDesc1: Move aged logs from hot storage to warm storage to save cost. You must enable
specifyOS.coldLogDesc1: Move aged logs from warm storage to cold storage to save cost. You must enable
specifyOS.coldLogMustThanWarm: Cold log must larger than warm log transition.
specifyOS.logRetentionDesc: Delete aged logs from OpenSearch domain.
specifyOS.logRetentionMustLargeThanCodeAndWarm: Log retention must larger than cold log transition and warm log transition.
specifyOS.indexSuffixDesc: The default index is <index name>-YYYY-MM-DD. You can choose a different suffix to adjust the index rollover time window. For example, if you select “YYYY-MM-DD-HH” suffix, OpenSearch will rollover the index by hour.

ingestion.name: Ingest
ingestion.selectOnlineInstance: Please select log agent online instance or waiting all log agent installed successfully.

createInstanceGroup.newDesc: Create a new log group and select instances.
createInstanceGroup.existsDesc: Choose existing log groups on the next page.

chooseInstanceGroup.chooseDesc: Select multiple instance groups and apply the same Log Config.

applyConfig.name: Apply log config
applyConfig.nameDesc: Create a new Log Config or select exists.
applyConfig.chooseExistsSyslog: Choose an existing log config.  Only can choose syslog-supported log config (i.e., Single-line Text, Syslog, JSON).

specifySource.s3Desc: Select an Amazon S3 bucket where your application log lives
specifySource.selectS3: Please select a Amazon S3 Bucket
specifySource.logPrefixDesc: Specify the prefix of the logs
specifySource.fileTypeDesc: Specify the way you compress your logs
specifySource.selectFileType: Please select a log file type
specifySource.vpcIdDesc: Select the VPC will start EC2 instances for log ingestion.
specifySource.subnetIdsDesc: Select the public subnets will start EC2 instances for log ingestion.

specifyConfig.alert: The 'Log Path' in the Log Config will be ignored as the Amazon S3 file path will be used when parsing your logs.
specifyConfig.configDesc: Choose an existing log config for
specifyConfig.configDesc2: file type specified as source. To create a new config, go to

specifySource.eksDesc1: Select an imported EKS cluster. You must
specifySource.eksDesc3: before you select from the list.

syslog.protocolDesc: Select the protocal of your syslog source
syslog.portDesc: Specifies the port to receive the log server
syslog.portOutofRange: The port number must be between 500 and 20000
